official-title.#text: To amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to provide for the proper Federal management and oversight of transboundary hydrocarbon reservoirs, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 27, 2013.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

header.#text: Amendment to the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Outer Continental Shelf Transboundary Hydrocarbon Agreements Authorization Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Outer Continental Shelf Transboundary Hydrocarbon Agreements Authorization Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may implement the terms of any transboundary hydrocarbon agreement for the management of transboundary hydrocarbon reservoirs entered into by the
. In implementing such an agreement, the

shall protect the interests of the United States to promote domestic job creation and ensure the expeditious and orderly development and conservation of domestic mineral resources in accordance with all applicable United States laws governing the exploration, development, and production of hydrocarbon resources on the outer Continental Shelf.

text.#text: After the date of enactment of the

No later than 180 days after all parties to a transboundary hydrocarbon agreement have agreed to its terms, a transboundary hydrocarbon agreement that does not constitute a treaty in the judgment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: the
the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives

text.#text: the Chair of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chair of the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

text.#text: the
The submission shall include—
any amendments to this Act or other Federal law necessary to implement the agreement;

an analysis of the economic impacts such an agreement and any amendments necessitated by the agreement will have on domestic exploration, development, and production of hydrocarbon resources on the outer Continental Shelf; and
a detailed description of any regulations expected to be issued by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may take actions as necessary to implement the terms of the Agreement between the United States of America and the United Mexican States Concerning Transboundary Hydrocarbon Reservoirs in the Gulf of Mexico, signed at Los Cabos, February 20, 2012, including—

text.#text: The

header.#text: Implementation of specific transboundary agreement with Mexico

text.#text: approving unitization agreements and related arrangements for the exploration, development, or production of oil and natural gas from transboundary reservoirs or geological structures;

making available, in the limited manner necessary under the agreement and subject to the protections of confidentiality provided by the agreement, information relating to the exploration, development, and production of oil and natural gas from a transboundary reservoir or geological structure that may be considered confidential, privileged, or proprietary information under law;
taking actions consistent with an expert determination under the agreement; and

ensuring only appropriate inspection staff at the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement or other Federal agency personnel designated by the Bureau, the operator, or the lessee have authority to stop work on any installation or other device or vessel permanently or temporarily attached to the seabed of the United States, which may be erected thereon for the purpose of resource exploration, development or production activities as approved by the
Actions taken by a public company in accordance with any transboundary hydrocarbon agreement shall not constitute the commercial development of oil, natural gas, or minerals for purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 13(q) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

header.#text: Exemption from resources extraction reporting requirement

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to participate in any negotiations, conferences, or consultations with Cuba regarding exploration, development, or production of hydrocarbon resources in the Gulf of Mexico along the United States maritime border with Cuba or the area known by the

text.#text: to authorize the
as affecting the sovereign rights and the jurisdiction that the United States has under international law over the outer Continental Shelf which appertains to it.

header.#text: Amendment to the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act

text.#text: The Agreement between the United States of America and the United Mexican States Concerning Transboundary Hydrocarbon Reservoirs in the Gulf of Mexico, signed at Los Cabos, February 20, 2012, is hereby approved.

short-title.#text: Outer Continental Shelf Transboundary Hydrocarbon Agreements Authorization Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1613 EH: Outer Continental Shelf Transboundary Hydrocarbon Agreements Authorization Act
